title: The difference between Garena Twitch chat and Riot Twitch chat is fascinating
body:
Garena Twitch chat seems to spam numbers often and has very few twitch chat emotes. They begin spamming significantly when a mistake is made, usually the number 87. When an impressive play is made, I see them focus on the person getting outplayed rather than the person performing the outplay. 

The spam that I'm aware of usually consists of repeating the same character in a long line, such as 777777777 or 444444 or GGGGGG or that slanted Korean character that looks like an F. 

I most likely am missing something more in the words they are using since I can't read them. 

I wonder if Asian culture is far more focused on mistakes and humiliation rather than praise for success. With the use of numbers and lack of facial emotes, I feel they are much more cold and calculated rather than emotionally driven. I wonder why the differences are noticable.
